_header: Lullay lullay lullay little child why weepest thou so sore
Note: This song is repeated in Latin at f. 62; for a Lullaby in the same measure sung by the Virgin Mary see 3300; stanza 4 is practically identical with 5367.
Subjects: lullabies; evils of the times; vanity, against worldly
_description: A Lullaby warning against the evils of this world — six 6-line stanzas (aaaabb)

BLHar913.First Lines:
Lollai .l. litil child whi wepistou so soreNedis mostou wepe hit
                    was iȝarkid þe ȝore…
BLHar913.Last Lines:
…Lolla .l. litil chil þis wo adam þe wroȝtWhan
                    he of þe appil ete and eue hit him betacht
BLHar913.Note:
Transcript in London,  British Library Addit. 20091, ff.
                    58v-60.
